hints.content: He is a 'diamond in the rough'.
His best friend is a monkey named Abu.
He discovers a magical object in the Cave of Wonders.
He pretends to be Prince Ali Ababwa.
He falls in love with the Princess of Agrabah.
He asks a powerful being for three wishes.
He gives his last wish to set a friend free.
He is often chased by palace guards for stealing food.
He flies on a Magic Carpet.
One jump ahead of the breadline.
He defeats an evil sorcerer who turns into a giant snake.
He lives in a dilapidated tower with a view of the palace.
Scott Weinger provided his speaking voice.
He is an orphan who dreams of a better life.
He tricks a genie into getting him out of a cave without using a wish.
His father is the King of Thieves.
He wears a small purple vest and white pants.
He promises to show the princess 'a whole new world'.
He is called a 'street rat' by others.
He saves the Sultan from being hypnotized.
She follows a White Rabbit down a hole.
She attends a very unbirthday tea party.
She changes size by eating cakes and drinking potions.
She meets a cat with a disappearing body and a wide grin.
She plays croquet with a flamingo and a hedgehog.
She is put on trial by the Queen of Hearts.
She wears a blue dress and a white apron.
She has a pet cat named Dinah.
She gets lost in the Tulgey Wood.
She is bored by her sister's history lesson.
Curiouser and curiouser!
She meets a caterpillar smoking a hookah.
She is voiced by Kathryn Beaumont.
She almost drowns in a sea of her own tears.
She encounters a Dodo bird.
She paints the roses red to save the gardeners.
She is a young British girl with blonde hair.
She wakes up to realize it was all a dream.
She recites 'How Doth the Little Busy Bee' incorrectly.
She is judged for her lack of height by flowers.
She is a character from Lady and the Tramp II: Scamp's Adventure.
She is a Pomeranian/Siberian Husky mix.
She is Scamp's love interest.
She was once a house dog but became a stray.
She sings 'I Didn't Know That I Could Feel This Way'.
She helps Scamp realize the value of a family.
She has cream-colored fur and floppy ears.
She is voiced by Alyssa Milano.
She rescues Scamp from the pound.
She is often seen in a junkyard.
She has had five different families.
She fights Buster to protect Scamp.
She is adopted by the Dear family at the end.
She calls Scamp 'Tenderfoot'.
She wants to belong to a family more than anything.
She meets Scamp while he is running away from home.
She is street-smart and tough.
She has a small notch in her left ear.
She warns Scamp about the dangers of the streets.
She is a sequel character to a 1955 classic.
He is the drummer for Dr. Teeth and the Electric Mayhem.
He has wild pink/red hair and orange skin.
He often shouts 'BEAT DRUMS!'.
He is a Muppet.
He has to be chained to his drum kit sometimes.
He chases women shouting 'WOMAN!'.
He eats his drums occasionally.
He is performed by Frank Oz originally.
He wears a spiked collar.
He communicates mostly in grunts and shouts.
He was inspired by Keith Moon of The Who.
He appears in The Muppet Show.
He has bushy eyebrows and no visible nose.
He plays in a band with Floyd Pepper and Janice.
He tries to eat a bunny in a Muppet movie.
He grows to giant size in 'Muppets from Space'.
He finds a hobby in bunny-sitting.
He wears a torn peasant shirt and rope belt.
He is pure id and energy.
He shouts 'MAMA!' when scared.
She is the Princess of Arendelle.
Her sister has ice powers.
She wants to build a snowman.
She falls in love with an ice harvester.
She has a white streak in her hair.
She gets engaged to a prince she just met.
She saves her sister from being killed by Hans.
She freezes into solid ice.
She loves chocolate.
She sings 'For the First Time in Forever'.
She is voiced by Kristen Bell.
She punches a prince in the face.
She has two braids.
She travels to the North Mountain.
She buys winter gear from Oaken's Trading Post.
She is fearless and optimistic.
She becomes Queen of Arendelle in the sequel.
She destroys a dam to free the forest.
She has a talking snowman friend.
Wait, what?
